p: Probiotics are a class of beneficial active microorganisms or their cultures. Probiotics could reduce CH 4 emissions in ruminants ( Table 2). There are many types of probiotics, and different strains have different inhibitory effects on CH 4 emissions. For example, the GA03 strain of Acetobacter is more effective at inhibiting CH 4 production than other isolated strains ( Kim et al., 2020b). Most probiotics reduce CH 4 production by influencing the activities of ruminal microorganisms, with no adverse effects on animals. In addition, probiotics enhance ruminal fermentation.
